metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27786 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s implementation of MIDI, where an attacker with a local account and the permissions to issue ioctl commands to midi devices could trigger a use-after-free issue. A write to this specific memory while freed and before use causes the flow of execution to change and possibly allow for memory corruption or privilege escalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1077-aws - 4.15.0-1077.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-109.110').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1077.81').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
